question: Yes! Damn! DELLA!
answer: SHOOT, KENNETH! That's Tammi's favorite doll.

question: You should just swear properly and get it over with. Do you think the kids don't know what you mean? Going out again? What is it tonight? Auto Mechanics for Dummies? The bored housewives' reading group? I got a new one for you. Group therapy for women who always have the curse. There's a Tuesday night class at the Pleasant Valley Episcopalian.
answer: I'm going to the mall for wrapping paper.

question: What do you do all day, Della honey? Cause it sure isn't keeping house. This place is an eyesore. I'm mortgaged up to the eyeballs for this? I mean it's not like you're at some salon fancying up your hair or nails like the other men's wives. The last time I saw you wearing something sexy was our engagement party. God, Della, you used to be hot!
answer: Put the twins to bed by eight. Give them a chocolate cookie with their milk.

question: Jesus, Della. Della honey, I'm sorry.
answer: You better leave Santa a note. It's only three days until Christmas. The Mall. One chocolate cookie each and then Daddy will read you a bedtime story. Tomorrow night I'll read you the best bedtime story in the whole world. I promise. I'll check in on you both when I get back. To make sure you're sleeping. Thank you, Tammi, it's wonderful.

question: You better leave Santa a note. It's only three days until Christmas. The Mall. One chocolate cookie each and then Daddy will read you a bedtime story. Tomorrow night I'll read you the best bedtime story in the whole world. I promise. I'll check in on you both when I get back. To make sure you're sleeping. Thank you, Tammi, it's wonderful.
answer: Della inserts the key and turns it in the lock. The car sputters in defiance against the cold night.

question: Frick!
answer: She slows down, rolls down her window and swipes a chub card against the security panel. The gates slowly open. She drives through. The gates close behind her. She rolls the window up and makes a left turn onto. Della smiles mysteriously, reaches into the glove compartment with her free hand. She pushes aside a bunch of car papers, a flare, pulls out a check wallet hidden underneath - her secret hiding place for:

question: I'll get right on that Kenneth honey. AFTER you stop drinking. Hello?
answer: Della, it's Mary Messina.

question: Oh, hey.
answer: You okay sweetie?

question: Sure. How are you?
answer: I'm well.

question: How'd you get my cell number?
answer: I called Kenneth at the house.

question: And how'd that go? Did he give you an earful for disturbing his ninety ninth viewing of Lethal Weapon Four?
answer: Oh Della. Kenneth is always charming. At least to me.

question: Well, with the way you flaunt your double D boob job at the free fun PTA events that's hardly a surprise.
answer: What was that?

question: Oh nothing, Mary.
answer: You got lucky with that one. Patricia Ellis says he's the best looking guy in Pleasant Valley.

question: Well that wouldn't be hard. Mary, do you need something? Cause I gotta go.
answer: Yes, are you going to Tool School tomorrow?

question: TOOL SCHOOL?, Ouch, Mary. Do It Yourself Mechanics is without a doubt the most interesting thing in my life right now. I carry my beloved toolbox in the trunk at all times.
answer: I'm just joking, Della. You know me. I pre-paid ten classes and only made it to two. If you are going I could use a ride. I'd hate to miss another class.

question: Sorry, Mary, I'm skipping this week. Kenneth's parents are coming to stay for Christmas. You know how it is.
answer: Oh that's too bad. Maybe Patricia Ellis will be going.

question: You check with her, Mary.
answer: Merry Christmas. God bless you and your family.

question: You too. Bah Humbug.
answer: Pardon?

question: Bye, Mary. The Learning Academy. Spring Street.
answer: Learning Academy, this is Meghan.

question: Hi Meghan. It's Della Myers.
answer: Oh hey. You calling about Spanish for Beginners? You know that Tom cancelled 'cause of New Year's.

question: Yes I knew.
answer: Can you hold, I have another call?

question: Okay.
answer: Sorry Della ...

question: Can you leave word for Mike. I'm going to miss tomorrow's Mechanic's class. It's just the one time.
answer: Everyone misses that class at least once.

question: I guess some people find it boring.
answer: We'll see you the first week in January then?

question: Yes you will...unless I run off and become an outlaw or something. I have to go.
answer: Merry Christmas

question: You too. Hello?
answer: Hi Della... it's Cassie.

question: Where are you? Grand Central Station?
answer: Hold on, I'll take the phone outside.

question: FRICK!
answer: Just a minute, Della.

question: I almost rear-ended a car. Cassie? What's up, Cassie?
answer: I'm over at Southeast Plaza. What was it we need to get for Pilates?

question: Huh? One of those rubber balls, I think. I'm headed over there now. Ran out of Christmas wrapping paper. Would you believe it?
answer: It's hell here tonight. Everyone and their uncle is at the mall.

question: Aw shoot. My cell battery's dying. Damn, I must have left the charger in the other car.
answer: You want me to pick up something for you while I'm here?

question: No....I'm just. I mean I'm. Oh nothing.
answer: Your phone's breaking up Della. I'm not joking when I say it's packed over here.

question: It can't be that bad? Why don't we meet somewhere for a drink?
answer: Sure, but a latte's about the best they can do in this mall.

question: A latte's fine. Let's meet at the fountain opposite Victoria's Secret.
answer: Sounds good.

question: My battery's going. I'm a block away. See you in five minutes.
answer: Okay but I won't be able to wait very ....

question: GREAT! Thanks. No thanks. Not my size. A latte please? And a chocolate biscotti. Forget it, just the coffee. Della, two L's.
answer: Della, is that you?

question: Lynn Monroe!
answer: I knew it was you, Della. I haven't seen you since college. You left to marry some handsome jock and we never heard from you again.

question: Something like that. Do you live around here now?
answer: David and I just bought this divine house in Pleasant Valley. Do you know it? Great for the kids. It's the first time I've left the doors unlocked since I was a child growing up in the Midwest. David's been promoted to VP of United Motors so it's all happening for us. But enough of me. How are you?

question: Oh, we have two kids. Twins, Tammi and Terri.
answer: Why that's fantastic. Listen Della, it's been great talking to you but I have to go get my hair done! David and I are going out tomorrow night for a romantic dinner. I just bought this gorgeous teddy from Victoria's Secret. Hope we bump into each other again soon, sweetie. Merry Christmas

question: Another flash and Della's left side mirror shatters. Right or left, Della? Make a choice. Close to screaming now she speeds up. Hope. She pulls in and dims her lights, drives right up to the kiosk door. Her wipers struggle to cope. She can hardly see through the front window.
answer: The potholes yawn deeper. The asphalt ends. Gravel deteriorates to dirt.

question: She steers the Ford blindly.
answer: A wooden barrier with reflective stripes looms suddenly ahead.

question: She guns the engine and ducks sideways as her car PLOWS into the barrier.
answer: The Explorer SLAMS through and VEERS towards a clump of trees.

question: Della tries to sit upright but the auto's spinning too fast.
answer: The car swings, then CRASHES right into a Pine tree.

question: The Car stalls out. SILENCE. A prolonged moment.
answer: She closes the door behind her so's not to trigger the light switch. Finds her legs are giddy. Holds onto the door frame for a moment to steady herself.

question: Della turns the key. It barely even groans this time. Just a faint gurgle. Then gone.
answer: Della runs outside to the back of the car and feels about in the trunk.

question: Won't be long before we find her now. This baby could spot a needle in a haystack!
answer: We caught up in this bitch's life like a soap opera. We could just bail, blast out of town like we was never here.

question: This boy loves weed so much he tried to marry Juana.
answer: Ain't no one cares about the Rent-a- Pig. He just collateral damage to the peeps at the mall.

question: Listen up skippy
answer: But if we hit the road now we'll be five hundred miles away before they find him....we could be drinking cold beer and swimmin' in the Atlantic....just like you promised.

question: We gotta take care of her. When she gone. The problem gone. Right? We'll head off then, Huey, just like I said.
answer: We ain't gonna make it, are we Chuckie? I ain't never gonna see it. It's over for that, isn't it Chuckie? Just say it. She was just some stupid housewife mouthin' off.

question: GET REAL Huey! And shut the fuck up about the stupid ocean. I ever break a promise to you? I ever let you down?
answer: No Chuckie, you ain't.

question: When a nigga hungry, Imma wolf.
answer: What was that? Peek a boo!

question: Yo left without yo goodbye kiss.
answer: You a window shopper little brother. You ain't never even done the old in and out before.

question: My little brother.
answer: Mamacita! Madre de Dios!

question: You tread on my boy's face. YOU
answer: I didn't kill him. I didn't kill no one. She did it. She killed him. I'm gonna cross that bitch out.

question: What the fuck you doing? I asked you what your deal is, sand dancer?
answer: It's a tribute. A gesture.

question: A what? Your brain even smaller than 'em slits for eyes? Keep on banging out that ghetto ass shit and you'll alert every cop in Podunk county.
answer: It's for Huey. Our dead homie.

question: You checked out, right?
answer: He loved that track.

question: You best hope not, genius. She gone, we gone. DELLA! D-E-L-L-A, H-O-N-E-Y.
answer: I can smell her Bulgari.

question: She was right here. Must a saw your dumb ass tribute and everything. Bulgari? She looks more like she rocks that number five shit.
answer: It Bulgari, dude. My Dad's bitch bathes in it.

question: Fell in a frozen ass stream.
answer: Zipperhead!

question: Kon'aro Kusotare.
answer: You know we don't speak the Chinky.

question: What's your game, Chuckie? We left stumbling around in the dark while you hog the flashlight.
answer: I stole it. I get to use it. That's how it works. That right Tomas?

question: TOMAS!
answer: Curb the squealing. You a gangsta or a boy scout?

question: Tomas's gone, Chuckie. I can feel it.
answer: Tomas is one hard son of a bitch. He got her strung up from a tree by now and you know it.

question: There's something over here. It looks like a body.
answer: It's a big old tree trunk, you paranoid gook.

question: Tomas.....IYAH! She gonna kill you and me next. We're all gonna die here. God knows what other tools she got in that box.
answer: It was a stupid ass accident killed Huey. You know that. And Tomas.... I promise you this. This baby's gonna cancel her Christmas.

question: Ain't no gun can kill a ghost gone bad.
answer: You in America now, dude, where the ghosts bleed.

question: Aaaarrhh. I don't feel good, Chuckie. You think I got the hypothermia?
answer: Nah, yo got the yellow fever.

question: I'm telling you, it ain't natural how she gets away every time.
answer: She got to be hiding up on the slope? You head up first and I'll follow with the flashlight.

question: I ain't going up there without the gun. End of story.
answer: Never would've pegged you as a pussy, Vinh. Even when Huey and Tomas called it, I always defended your ass.

question: Ain't no one never said I was a pussy.
answer: She a skinny ass bitch, too. Can't be weighing in at more than one twenty.

question: Tomas an Huey never called me a pussy.
answer: I ain't speaking ill o' the dead.

question: You already did.
answer: Anyways, when you ever shot a gun? Probably miss and shoot yourself in the foot. That's the spirit gangsta. Holler if you see her and I'll shoot.

question: Faito! CHUUUCCKKKKIEEE!
answer: Vinh? VINH? Della? Delllaaa? There's only you and me, now. I saw a little trail of your blood back there. You must be hurt. I'm hurting too. I think you busted up my collarbone. I know you can hear me, Della. After what went down tonight, we got a special bond. May as well come out now, Della. I'll save one for you, for when you decide to come out. You're one tough bitch. And that's hot, hell yeah. And they're really cute. Twins huh? Terri and Tammi. I bet you could use that cigarette now Della honey? A woman's purse can tell her whole life story! Now I know where they are living, I'm thinking I may stop by after and say hello. They wouldn't know a damn thing about what happened to Mommy while she was out, would they, Della? I figured that would help you find your voice! Don't worry. I would never touch them. It's wrong to hurt kids! Right, Della? The game's over. You won! You took him from me...He was only seventeen years old. And all he ever wanted to do was see the ocean. And he never saw it. No, he never got to go. They're all gone now. You know the movie "Clockwork Orange"? Well, they were my droogies, Della. Chances are they would of turned on me anyway, just like in the movie. None of them was real ass outlaw. No, not in the way you are. You're the real deal, lady. I was already thinking about cutting some of em loose, getting a new style posse together. How's about it, you and me?

No, not in the way you are. You're the real deal, lady. I was already thinking about cutting some of em loose, getting a new style posse together. How's about it, you and me?
answer: Give me a break.

question: Monday night mechanics. Tuesday Pilates. Wednesday Spanish. Thursday, I wish.... Face it, Della. You ain't no suburban housewife. So you bought into the big lie, even tried to live it. Who could blame you? Husband, kids, security, every woman's dream, but not yours, Della. You know there ain't no such thing as security. But I'm betting you didn't really know who you were until tonight. I reckon I know what you've been dreaming about though, what you've been aching for, through all these lonely, wasted years. Blasting out of Podunk without never looking back. Feeling the wind in your hair and the dirt of life between your fingers. Doing all the things they told you you ain't supposed to do. Taking what YOU want from life. And wasting anyone who stands in your way. Right, Della? Don't say you ain't thought about it. If it's in your blood, it's in your blood for all time. You had yourself fooled, Della. Shit, lady, you took my whole crew out with nothing but a bunch of them tools. You can't go back to your old life. No way. It's all over for that. Kaboom. Hooking up with me's about the best chance you got. I bet you're on the outs with your old man. When we pick up your kids, we can waste him if you like. I can do it. Or you can if you're ready.
answer: I want...

question: Leave the tools.
answer: I already did.

question: Hell of a night, huh?
answer: I was only going to the mall for some Christmas wrapping paper.

question: Shit happens.
answer: What now?

question: I wanted to look you in the eye before I kill you.
answer: That's what I figured. Huey there, going to help?
